page.title: 09A FARMER'S DAY
page.content: Mr. Shand is a self-employed farmer with a wife and two children. He owns 120 acres of mixed farming about a mile from Huntly. Mr. Shand gets up at 7.15 a.m. approximately. The first job he does in the morning is to go round his cattle. Then depending on the season he will do the fencing, cutting hay, taking in turnips or ploughing. The job he does not like doing is book-keeping and his favourite job is combining. Mr. Shand gets his dinner at 12 o'clock until 1 O'clock in the afternoon. Depending on the season, he may do baling or combining. At nights he works outside or does book-keeping. He buys his cattle from the mart but seldom sells any there. Mr. Shand has most machinery needed for farming and is successful in the farming business.
